profiles.description: (beta) can override be used to build, test or deploy configuration.

artifacts.description: the images you're going to be building.

tagPolicy.description: (beta) determines how images are tagged. A few strategies are provided here, although you most likely won't need to care! If not specified, it defaults to gitCommit: {}.

executionEnvironment.description: environment in which the build should run. Possible values: googleCloudBuild.

local.description: (beta) describes how to do a build on the local docker daemon and optionally push to a repository.

googleCloudBuild.description: (beta) describes how to do a remote build on Google Cloud Build.

kaniko.description: (beta) describes how to do an on-cluster build using Kaniko.

BuildConfig.description: contains all the configuration for the build steps.

properties.description: key-value pairs passed to the environment.

ExecutionEnvironment.description: environment in which the build should run (ex. local or in-cluster, etc.).

properties.description: key-value pairs passed to the plugin.

BuilderPlugin.description: contains all fields necessary for specifying a build plugin.

gitCommit.description: (beta) tags images with the git tag or commit of the artifact's workspace.

sha256.description: (beta) tags images with their sha256 digest.

envTemplate.description: (beta) tags images with a configurable template string.

dateTime.description: (beta) tags images with the build timestamp.

TagPolicy.description: contains all the configuration for the tagging step.

ShaTagger.description: (beta) tags images with their sha256 digest.

GitTagger.description: (beta) tags images with the git tag or commit of the artifact's workspace.

template.description: used to produce the image name and tag. See golang text/template. The template is executed against the current environment, with those variables injected: IMAGE_NAME | Name of the image being built, as supplied in the artifacts section.

EnvTemplateTagger.description: (beta) tags images with a configurable template string.

format.description: formats the date and time. See #Time.Format.

timezone.description: sets the timezone for the date and time. See Time.LoadLocation. Defaults to the local timezone.

DateTimeTagger.description: (beta) tags images with the build timestamp.

local.description: (beta) describes how to do a build on the local docker daemon and optionally push to a repository.

googleCloudBuild.description: (beta) describes how to do a remote build on Google Cloud Build.

kaniko.description: (beta) describes how to do an on-cluster build using Kaniko.

BuildType.description: contains the specific implementation and parameters needed for the build step. Only one field should be populated.

push.description: should images be pushed to a registry. If not specified, images are pushed only if the current Kubernetes context connects to a remote cluster.

useDockerCLI.description: use docker command-line interface instead of Docker Engine APIs.

useBuildkit.description: use BuildKit to build Docker images.

LocalBuild.description: (beta) describes how to do a build on the local docker daemon and optionally push to a repository.

projectId.description: ID of your Cloud Platform Project. If it is not provided, Skaffold will guess it from the image name. For example, given the artifact image name gcr.io/myproject/image, Skaffold will use the myproject GCP project.

diskSizeGb.description: disk size of the VM that runs the build. See Cloud Build Reference.

machineType.description: type of the VM that runs the build. See Cloud Build Reference.

timeout.description: amount of time (in seconds) that this build should be allowed to run. See Cloud Build Reference.

dockerImage.description: image that runs a Docker build. See Cloud Builders.

mavenImage.description: image that runs a Maven build. See Cloud Builders.

gradleImage.description: image that runs a Gradle build. See Cloud Builders.

GoogleCloudBuild.description: (beta) describes how to do a remote build on Google Cloud Build. Docker and Jib artifacts can be built on Cloud Build. The projectId needs to be provided and the currently logged in user should be given permissions to trigger new builds.

LocalDir.description: configures how Kaniko mounts sources directly via an emptyDir volume.

gcsBucket.description: CGS bucket to which sources are uploaded by Skaffold. Kaniko will need access to that bucket to download the sources.

localDir.description: configures how Kaniko mounts sources directly via an emptyDir volume.

KanikoBuildContext.description: contains the different fields available to specify a Kaniko build context.

repo.description: a remote repository to store cached layers. If none is specified, one will be inferred from the image name. See Kaniko Caching.

KanikoCache.description: configures Kaniko caching. If a cache is specified, Kaniko will use a remote cache which will speed up builds.

buildContext.description: defines where Kaniko gets the sources from.

cache.description: configures Kaniko caching. If a cache is specified, Kaniko will use a remote cache which will speed up builds.

flags.description: additional flags to be passed to Kaniko command line. See Kaniko Additional Flags.

pullSecret.description: path to the secret key file. See Kaniko Documentation.

pullSecretName.description: name of the Kubernetes secret for pulling the files from the build context and pushing the final image.

namespace.description: Kubernetes namespace. Defaults to current namespace in Kubernetes configuration.

timeout.description: amount of time (in seconds) that this build is allowed to run. Defaults to 20 minutes (20m).

image.description: Docker image used by the Kaniko pod. Defaults to the latest released version of gcr.io/kaniko-project/executor.

dockerConfig.description: describes how to mount the local Docker configuration into the Kaniko pod.

KanikoBuild.description: (beta) describes how to do an on-cluster build using Kaniko.

secretName.description: Kubernetes secret that will hold the Docker configuration.

DockerConfig.description: contains information about the docker config.json to mount.

image.description: artifact on which to run those tests.

structureTests.description: the Container Structure Tests to run on that artifact.

TestCase.description: a list of structure tests to run on images that Skaffold builds.

helm.description: (beta) uses the helm CLI to apply the charts to the cluster.

kubectl.description: (beta) uses a client side kubectl apply to deploy manifests. You'll need a kubectl CLI version installed that's compatible with your cluster.

kustomize.description: (beta) uses the kustomize CLI to "patch" a deployment for a target environment.

DeployConfig.description: contains all the configuration needed by the deploy steps.

helm.description: (beta) uses the helm CLI to apply the charts to the cluster.

kubectl.description: (beta) uses a client side kubectl apply to deploy manifests. You'll need a kubectl CLI version installed that's compatible with your cluster.

kustomize.description: (beta) uses the kustomize CLI to "patch" a deployment for a target environment.

DeployType.description: contains the specific implementation and parameters needed for the deploy step. Only one field should be populated.

manifests.description: the Kubernetes yaml or json manifests.

KubectlDeploy.description: (beta) uses a client side kubectl apply to deploy manifests. You'll need a kubectl CLI version installed that's compatible with your cluster.

global.description: additional flags passed on every command.

apply.description: additional flags passed on creations (kubectl apply).

delete.description: additional flags passed on deletions (kubectl delete).

KubectlFlags.description: additional flags passed on the command line to kubectl either on every command (Global), on creations (Apply) or deletions (Delete).

HelmDeploy.description: (beta) uses the helm CLI to apply the charts to the cluster.

KustomizeDeploy.description: (beta) uses the kustomize CLI to "patch" a deployment for a target environment.

values.description: key-value pairs supplementing the Helm values file".

setValues.description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will send --set flag to Helm CLI and append all pairs after the flag.

setValueTemplates.description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will try to parse the value part of each key-value pair using environment variables in the system, then send --set flag to Helm CLI and append all parsed pairs after the flag.

wait.description: if true, Skaffold will send --wait flag to Helm CLI.

recreatePods.description: if true, Skaffold will send --recreate-pods flag to Helm CLI.

overrides.description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will build a Helm values file that overrides the original and use it to call Helm CLI (--f flag).

packaged.description: parameters for packaging helm chart (helm package).

imageStrategy.description: adds image configurations to the Helm values file.

version.description: sets the version on the chart to this semver version.

appVersion.description: sets the appVersion on the chart to this version.

HelmPackaged.description: parameters for packaging helm chart (helm package).

helm.description: image configuration uses the syntax IMAGE-NAME.repository=IMAGE-REPOSITORY, IMAGE-NAME.tag=IMAGE-TAG.

HelmImageStrategy.description: adds image configurations to the Helm values file.

helm.description: image configuration uses the syntax IMAGE-NAME.repository=IMAGE-REPOSITORY, IMAGE-NAME.tag=IMAGE-TAG.

HelmFQNConfig.description: image config to use the FullyQualifiedImageName as param to set.

HelmConventionConfig.description: image config in the syntax of image.repository and image.tag.

image.description: name of the image to be built.

context.description: directory where the artifact's sources are to be found.

sync.description: (alpha) lists local files that can be synced to remote pods instead of triggering an image build when modified. This is a mapping of local files to sync to remote folders.

plugin.description: plugin used to build this artifact.

docker.description: (beta) describes an artifact built from a Dockerfile.

bazel.description: (beta) requires bazel CLI to be installed and the sources to contain Bazel configuration files.

jibMaven.description: (alpha) builds images using the Jib plugin for Maven.

jibGradle.description: (alpha) builds images using the Jib plugin for Gradle.

Artifact.description: items that need to be built, along with the context in which they should be built.

patches.description: a list of patches applied to the configuration. This is used change a few values and not replace whole sections. Patches use the JSON patch notation. For example, this replaces the dockerfile of the 1st artifact with Dockerfile.DEV.

activation.description: criteria by which a profile can be auto-activated. This can be based on Environment Variables, the current Kubernetes context name, or depending on which Skaffold command is running.

Profile.description: (beta) profiles are used to override any build, test or deploy configuration.

env.description: a key=value pair. The profile is auto-activated if an Environment Variable key has value value.

kubeContext.description: a Kubernetes context for which the profile is auto-activated.

command.description: a Skaffold command for which the profile is auto-activated.

Activation.description: criteria by which a profile is auto-activated.

docker.description: (beta) describes an artifact built from a Dockerfile.

bazel.description: (beta) requires bazel CLI to be installed and the sources to contain Bazel configuration files.

jibMaven.description: (alpha) builds images using the Jib plugin for Maven.

jibGradle.description: (alpha) builds images using the Jib plugin for Gradle.

dockerfile.description: locates the Dockerfile relative to workspace.

buildArgs.description: arguments passed to the docker build.

cacheFrom.description: the Docker images to consider as cache sources.

DockerArtifact.description: (beta) describes an artifact built from a Dockerfile, usually using docker build.

args.description: additional args to pass to bazel build.

BazelArtifact.description: (beta) describes an artifact built with Bazel.

module.description: selects which Maven module to build, for a multi module project.

profile.description: selects which Maven profile to activate.

args.description: additional build flags passed to Maven.

JibMavenArtifact.description: (alpha) builds images using the Jib plugin for Maven.

project.description: selects which Gradle project to build.

args.description: additional build flags passed to Gradle.

JibGradleArtifact.description: (alpha) builds images using the Jib plugin for Gradle.
